decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly comboing off by using Cephalid Illusionist in combination with Nomads en-Kor to mill through the library, eventually leading to a win condition with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck includes protection with Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. It also utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom for additional card advantage. The mana base includes lands like Tundra, Island','','');">Tropical Island, and Urza's Saga to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Murktide Regent, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo win. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its game plan while controlling the opponent's plays. With a mix of card draw and countermagic, the deck is designed to efficiently set up its powerful reanimation combos and overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly ramp into powerful red mana sources like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb, while disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon. By establishing a dominant board presence with aggressive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Fury, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can set up their own game plan. The inclusion of powerful spells like Sundering Eruption and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker further solidifies the deck's aggressive playstyle.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also disrupts the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Opposition Agent. The key strategy is to cheat out big threats early in the game, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck also has some control elements with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Collective Brutality to handle threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence with threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and versatile spells like Cling to Dust allow the deck to outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana for maximum flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful enchantments like Chancellor of the Annex and Magus of the Moon. By ramping quickly with mana-producing lands and acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Broadside Bombardiers. By locking the opponent out with cards like Chalice of the Void and Magus of the Moon, this deck aims to be proactive and aggressive in its strategy while denying the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty, while also controlling the game with cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to ensure victory.

This deck focuses on using small, efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a strong board presence with creatures like Luminarch Aspirant and Champion of the Parish. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Suppression Field and Sanctifier en-Vec to further hinder the opponent. Overall, the goal is to apply constant pressure and quickly defeat the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes disruption spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to control the board, while also playing creatures like Containment Priest and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to hinder the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck has cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to provide card advantage and utility. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's resources and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly cheating big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void to control the game and protect its combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, hard-to-answer threats, while also having the flexibility to win through alternate win conditions like Omniscience if needed. It is a high-risk, high-reward combo deck that can win games in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Lightning Bolt to quickly pressure the opponent and control the board. The deck also includes cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and Mishra's Bauble to gather information and gain card advantage. With a low mana curve and a focus on tempo, this UR Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes powerful cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to apply pressure, while also having efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also providing card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and includes tempo plays with Wasteland.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It combines disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets to maintain tempo and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Murktide Regent provide additional damage and threats, while utility lands like Wasteland offer disruption. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle and other mana sources to ramp up and control the game. It aims to establish a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Endurance and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Wasteland and Snuff Out. The deck also includes various ways to tutor for key cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently managing resources and applying pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands in combination with various spells and artifacts to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to generate powerful token creatures with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, while also utilizing cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration to maximize land ramp and recursion. The deck includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Grafdigger's Cage to hinder the opponent's plays, along with resource denial through cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through strategic land manipulation and control.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. The deck includes a mix of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as card draw and mana fixing to help set it up. The inclusion of creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent provide additional threats that can quickly end the game if not dealt with.
